select s.id as subjectId,s.name as subjectName,s.user_id as userId ,count(point.id) as pointCount,count(single.id) as choiceCount, count(judge.id) as judgementCount,count(b.id) as blankCount,count(short.id) as shortAnswerCount from subject s left join knowledge_point point on s.id = point.subject_id and point.status = 0 left join single as single on s.id =single.subject_id and single.status = 0 left join judgement as judge on s.id = judge.subject_id and judge.status = 0 left join blank as b on s.id = b.subject_id and b.status = 0 left join short_answer as short on s.id = short.subject_id and short.status = 0
and s.name like concat('%', #{subjectVo.name}, '%')
and s.status = 0
group by s.id,s.name
